intro: Microchilus mazarunensis, commonly known as the Canary Islands rock violet, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, violet-blue flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the arid climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
